main event: Very bright light observed in the sky in Lexington, Wachusett, Massachusetts on 29 December 1954. The light maneuvered in a zig-zag pattern, ascended rapidly, and its disappearance was delayed by the observer's afterimage.
interesting points: The UFO was described as an oval shape, 50-75 ft in diameter, with a metallic surface and no visible rivets, seams, or openings.
It appeared to be drifting or floating with a spinning motion, with no visible exhaust, and it hovered for a few minutes before accelerating rapidly in horizontal and vertical directions.
Multiple witnesses observed the UFO, and there was no sound or trail left behind by the object.
The estimated duration of the sighting was 10-15 minutes, and the flight path moved over mountainous terrain with varied maneuvers.
The UFO report was sent to the Air Defense Command at the Ent Air Force Base in Colorado Springs, Colorado.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object with an oval shape and metallic surface
